intro: Hieracium obtexticeps, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the daisy family (Asteraceae). It is characterized by its dense, woolly covering on the stems and leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Native to Europe, it is often found in meadows and grassy areas. It is a perennial species that thrives in temperate climates.
